articles.title: Power politics: Rising electricity bills are central to this year’s elections
articles.summary: America’s aging power grid has faced strain for years, exacerbated by severe weather events, an explosion of data centers and the demand created by artificial intelligence.
articles.translated_title: Power politics: Rising electricity bills are central to this year’s elections
articles.translated_summary: America’s aging power grid has faced strain for years, exacerbated by severe weather events, an explosion of data centers and the demand created by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Tesla Shareholders to Vote on xAI Investment in November
articles.summary: Tesla Inc. shareholders will vote in November to decide if the electric carmaker should invest in Elon Musk’s closely held artificial intelligence startup, xAI.
articles.translated_title: Tesla Shareholders to Vote on xAI Investment in November
articles.translated_summary: Tesla Inc. shareholders will vote in November to decide if the electric carmaker should invest in Elon Musk’s closely held artificial intelligence startup, xAI.

articles.title: Tesla floats new pay plan for Musk that would expand his voting power
articles.summary: Tesla will also ask shareholders to vote on whether the automaker should invest in Musk's artificial intelligence company, xAI.
articles.translated_title: Tesla floats new pay plan for Musk that would expand his voting power
articles.translated_summary: Tesla will also ask shareholders to vote on whether the automaker should invest in Musk's artificial intelligence company, xAI.

articles.title: Broadcom shares rally on new AI deal, CEO's assurance
articles.summary: Broadcom shares jumped 7% in premarket trading on Friday, as an upbeat outlook for artificial intelligence revenue and CEO Hock Tan's pledge to stay on for five more years reassured investors betting on the chipmaker's custom silicon strategy.
articles.translated_title: Broadcom shares rally on new AI deal, CEO's assurance
articles.translated_summary: Broadcom shares jumped 7% in premarket trading on Friday, as an upbeat outlook for artificial intelligence revenue and CEO Hock Tan's pledge to stay on for five more years reassured investors betting on the chipmaker's custom silicon strategy.

articles.title: AI needs a warning label before it’s too late
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence needs a warning label, much like the FDA's black box label, to alert parents of the dangers of this technology.
articles.translated_title: AI needs a warning label before it’s too late
articles.translated_summary: Artificial intelligence needs a warning label, much like the FDA's black box label, to alert parents of the dangers of this technology.

articles.title: Donald Trump Inviting Bill Gates to White House Sparks MAGA Fury
articles.summary: The White House event was held to support an initiative on artificial intelligence led by First Lady Melania Trump.
articles.translated_title: Donald Trump Inviting Bill Gates to White House Sparks MAGA Fury
articles.translated_summary: The White House event was held to support an initiative on artificial intelligence led by First Lady Melania Trump.

articles.title: OpenAI To Certify 10 Million Americans In Generative AI By 2030, Partnering With Walmart To Train The Next Wave Of AI-Savvy Workers
articles.summary: OpenAI announced it will offer generative AI certifications as businesses increasingly seek workers with artificial intelligence skills.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) giant OpenAI is going all-in on producing and deploying its own AI chips next year, with support from semiconductor...

articles.title: OpenAI To Mass-Produce 1st Proprietary AI Chip With Broadcom, Secures $10 Billion Deal: Report
articles.summary: OpenAI is set to begin mass production of its first proprietary artificial intelligence chip next year through a partnership with Broadcom.

articles.title: AI Investment Frenzy Leaves Tokyo Electron a Market Laggard
articles.summary: The global artificial intelligence investment frenzy is fast rewriting the fortunes of companies in the semiconductor industry. One notable laggard is Tokyo Electron Ltd.
